OMINAS Documentation

User Guide API Demos Installation Guide Search

Directory: com/pg/

Contents

.pro files

pg_array.pro

Computes image points for given array descriptors.

pg_bad_data.pro

Locates areas of bad data values like saturation and dropouts.

pg_blemish.pro

Removes blemishes from an image using interpolation.

pg_center.pro

Computes image coordinates of the center of each object.

pg_chisq.pro

Computes chi-squared value for given curve- or point-fit parameters.

pg_cntrd.pro

Calculates the centroids centered near given features in an image.

pg_coadd.pro

Averages the given images and geometries.

pg_core.pro

Generates a dn profile through a cube, or stack of images.

pg_coregister.pro

Using the given geometry information, shifts the given images so as to center the given bodies at the same pixel in each image, or aligns images based on pointing.

pg_covariance.pro

Computes a covariance matrix for the least-square fit specified by the input scan coefficients.

pg_crop.pro

Crops an image and modifies that camera descriptor accordingly.

pg_crop_points.pro

Hides image points that lie outside the field of view.

pg_cull_bodies.pro

Removes (and frees) bodies in a given array.

pg_cursor.pro

Allows the user to obtain information about image pixels selected using the mouse in the current graphics window.

pg_cusps.pro

Computes image points at the limb/terminator cusps for each given globe object.

pg_cvchisq.pro

Computes chi-squared value for given curve fit parameters.

pg_cvscan.pro

Attempts to find points of highest correlation with a given model along curves in an image.

pg_cvscan_coeff.pro

Computes linear least-squares coefficients for a fit to the image coordinate translation and rotation that matches a computed curve to a scanned curve in an image.

pg_data_adjust.pro

Allows the user to adjust data values using the mouse.

pg_despike.pro

Removes previously-located spurious features like cosmic-ray hits.

pg_disk.pro

Computes image points on the inner and outer edges of each given disk object at all given time steps.

pg_drag.pro

Allows the user to graphically translate and rotate an array of points using the mouse.

pg_drag_shadow_plane.pro

Allows the user to graphically rotate a plane passing through the center of a planet by dragging the shadow cast by the planet on the plane using the mouse.

pg_draw.pro

Calls pg_draw_point or pg_draw_vector depending on the input arrays. pg_draw_point is called is only one argument is given.

pg_draw_point.pro

Draws points from the given POINT on the current graphics window using the current data coordinate system.

pg_draw_vector.pro

Draws vectors on an image from a source towards a target.

pg_edges.pro

Scans an image for candidate edge points.

pg_exclude_points.pro

xx

pg_farfit.pro

Searches for the offset (dx,dy) that gives the best agreement between two uncorrelated sets of image points.

pg_fit.pro

Performs a simultaneous 1-,2-, or 3-parameter linear least-squares fit using the given coefficients.

pg_footprint.pro

Computes the footprint of a camera on a given body.

pg_get_arrays.pro

Obtains a array descriptor for the given data descriptor.

pg_get_cameras.pro

Obtains a camera descriptor for the given data descriptor.

pg_get_celestial_sphere.pro

Obtains a globe descriptor describing the celestial sphere.

pg_get_maps.pro

Obtains a map descriptor for the given data descriptor.

pg_get_planets.pro

Obtains planet descriptors for the given data descriptor.

pg_get_rings.pro

Obtains ring descriptors for the given data descriptor.

pg_get_sky.pro

Obtains a globe descriptor describing the sky.

pg_get_stars.pro

Obtain star descriptors for the given data descriptor.

pg_get_stations.pro

Obtains a station descriptor for the given data descriptor.

pg_grid.pro

Computes image points on a surface coordinate grid.

pg_hide.pro

Hides the given points with respect to each given object and observer using the hide methods of the given bodies.

pg_image_sector.pro

Allows the user to select a rectangular image region, with an arbitrary tilt, by clicking and dragging.

pg_limb.pro

Computes image points on the limb of each given globe object.

pg_limb_sector.pro

Allows the user to select an image sector along lines of constant azimuth and altitude above a planet by clicking and dragging.

pg_limb_sector_altaz.pro

Constructs a limb sector outline for use with pg_profile_ring given altitude and azimuth bounds.

pg_limb_sector_linear.pro

Constructs a limb sector outline for use with pg_profile_image, given altitude and length bounds.

pg_limb_sector_oblique.pro

Allows the user to select an image sector along lines of constant azimuth and altitude above a planet by clicking and dragging.

pg_linearize_image.pro

Reprojects an image onto a linear scale.

pg_load_maps.pro

Loads maps and descriptors from a map directory.

pg_map.pro

Generates map projections.

pg_mask.pro

Uses the given geometry to compute an image mask for all objects in a scene.

pg_measure.pro

Allows the user to measure quantities between two points in an image using the mouse in the current graphics window.

pg_mosaic.pro

Combines two or more maps into one.

pg_move.pro

Translates and rotates the given points.

pg_nearest_points.pro

xx

pg_northangle.pro

Computes the angle between the image-coordinate y-axis and the projected z-axis of the given body.

pg_occult_points.pro

Determines whether each given point is occulted by the given object relative to the given observer.

pg_photom.pro

Photometric image correction for disk or globe objects.

pg_photom_disk.pro

Photometric image correction for disk objects.

pg_photom_globe.pro

Photometric image correction for globe objects.

pg_profile_image.pro

Generates a dn profile along a line in an image.

pg_profile_ring.pro

Generates radial or longitudinal ring profiles from the given image using an image outline.

pg_ptassoc.pro

Associates points between two arrays by searching for the most frequent offset between the two.

pg_ptchisq.pro

Computes chi-squared value for given point fit parameters.

pg_ptcntrd.pro

Attempts to find points of highest correlation with a given model centered near given features in an image, then returns the centroid.

pg_ptfarscan.pro

Attempts to find all occurrences of a model in an image.

pg_ptscan.pro

Attempts to find points of highest correlation with a given model centered near given features in an image.

pg_ptscan_coeff.pro

Computes linear least-squares coefficients for a fit to the image coordinate offset which matches a point to a feature in an image.

pg_put_arrays.pro

Outputs array descriptors through the translators.

pg_put_cameras.pro

Outputs camera descriptors through the translators.

pg_put_maps.pro

Outputs map descriptors through the translators.

pg_put_planets.pro

Outputs planet descriptors through the translators.

pg_put_rings.pro

Outputs ring descriptors through the translators.

pg_put_stars.pro

Outputs star descriptors through the translators.

pg_put_stations.pro

Outputs station descriptors through the translators.

pg_range.pro

Computes distance between the centers of two bodies.

pg_ray.pro

Computes image points on each specified ray.

pg_reflection.pro

Computes image coordinates of given inertial vectors projected onto surface of the given disks and globes with respect to the given observer.

pg_reflection_disk.pro

Computes image coordinates of given inertial vectors reflected onto surface of the given disk with respect to the given observer.

pg_reflection_globe.pro

Computes image coordinates of the given inertial vectors projected onto surface of the given globe with respect to the given observer.

pg_render.pro

Performs rendering on an array of bodies.

pg_renderfit.pro

Searches for the offset (dx,dy) that gives the best agreement between two uncorrelated sets of image points.

pg_repoint.pro

Modifies the camera orientation matrix based on the given image coordinate translation and rotation.

pg_reposition.pro

Modifies the body position based on the given offset and observer.

pg_resfit.pro

Computes polynomial coefficients for a camera distortion model by comparing detected reseaus with the known focal plane locations.

pg_residuals.pro

Computes residuals value for given curve- or point-fit parameters.

pg_resloc.pro

Scans an image for candidate reseau marks.

pg_retarg.pro

Modifies the camera orientation such that the optic axis points along a given vector, or toward a specified body.

pg_ring_sector.pro

Allows the user to select a ring sector by clicking and dragging. With the left button, the sector is defined along lines of constant radius and longitude.

pg_ring_sector_box.pro

Allows the user to select a box to use with pg_profile_ring.

pg_ring_sector_box_oblique.pro

Allows the user to select an oblique box to use with pg_profile_ring.

pg_ring_sector_box_ortho.pro

Allows the user to select a box to use with pg_profile_ring.

pg_ring_sector_oblique.pro

Allows the user to select a ring sector by clicking and dragging. The top and bottom of the sector are defined along lines of constant radius, while the sides are perpendicular to the image-projected radial direction.

pg_ring_sector_perp.pro

Allows the user to select a ring sector by clicking and dragging. The top and bottom of the sector are defined along lines of constant radius, while the sides are perpendicular to the image-projected radial direction.

pg_ring_sector_rad.pro

Allows the user to select a ring sector by clicking and dragging. The sector is defined along lines of constant radius and longitude.

pg_ring_sector_radlon.pro

Constructs a ring sector outline for use with pg_profile_ring given radius and longitude bounds.

pg_rm_points.pro

xx

pg_select.pro

Allows the user to select objects in an image using the mouse.

pg_select_bodies.pro

Selects bodies based on given criteria.

pg_select_points.pro

Allows the user to select points in an image using the mouse.

pg_select_region.pro

Allows the user to select regions in an image using the mouse.

pg_shadow.pro

Computes image coordinates of given inertial vectors projected onto surface of the given disks and globes with respect to the given observer.

pg_shadow_disk.pro

Computes image coordinates of given inertial vectors projected onto surface of the given disk with respect to the given observer.

pg_shadow_globe.pro

Computes image coordinates of the given inertial vectors projected onto surface of the given globe with respect to the given observer.

pg_shift.pro

Shifts the given image by a non-integer offset and adjusts the camera pointing accordingly.

pg_sort_args.pro

Sorts arguments to pg_get_* programs.

pg_spikes.pro

Locates spurious features like cosmic-ray hits.

pg_station.pro

Computes image points for given station descriptors.

pg_stereo_split.pro

Produces two camera descriptors whose positions are offset in the +/-x image directions for computing stereo overlays.

pg_str_limit_mag.pro

Removes stars whose visual magnitude falls outside the given minimum and maximum values.

pg_strip.pro

Plots the portion of an image between two chosen points.

pg_sub_body.pro

Computes surface coordinates of sub-body point.

pg_threshold.pro

Excludes points whose associated data lie outside of specified thresholds by setting the PTD_MASK_INVISIBLE.

pg_tiepoints.pro

Computes tiepoint image offsets.

pg_trim.pro

For each given object, excludes points contained in the given region by setting the PTD_MASK_INVISIBLE.
